text: The National Liberation Movement (; or Lëvizja Antifashiste Nacional- Çlirimtare (LANÇ)),Miranda Vickers, James Pettifer Albania: from anarchy to a Balkan identity, C Hurst & Co Publishers, 1997 p. 291 was an Albanian communist resistance organization that fought in World War II. It was created on 16 September 1942, in a conference held in Pezë, a village near Tirana, and was led by Enver Hoxha. == References == Category:Organizations based in Albania
title: National Liberation Movement (Albania)
